pageTitle: Presenting The Deadspin Fantasy Football Almanac: An Unofficial Record Book For 1970-2011
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {232=The Brady Award: Given to the quarterback with the highest point total. Named after Tom Brady for his record-breaking 2007 performance., 58852=The Tomlinson Award: Given to the player who has the highest value with respect to his position. The award is named after LaDanian Tomlinson for his 2007 2006 season. Value is measured in VBD, which stands for "Value Based Drafting." VBD takes the player's point total and subtracts the point total of the baseline starter at that position. PFR's VBD calculation uses the 12th best QBs and TEs, the 24th best RB, and the 30th best WR as the baseline starters. It also adjusts the totals for years with shorter schedules. While the exact value of VBD can vary depending on the baseline level, the important thing is that it allows us to compare across positions. It's the best stat for a basic MVP award.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {45032=The Hall of Fame: A lifetime fantasy achievement award. Chase Stuart at Football Perspective added up career totals for NFL players since 1950. Jerry Rice was the best by a long shot., 32378=The Beuerlein Award: Given to the player who provided the most value with respect to where fantasy owners drafted him. I used My Fantasy League's average draft position (ADP) records, which date back to 1999, to estimate the draft spot, and VBD to estimate value. The award is named after Steve Beuerlein, the first winner.}
textBeforeTable: The Brady Award: Given to the quarterback with the highest point total. Named after Tom Brady for his record-breaking 2007 performance. No fantasy scoring system is more valid than any other, but I used the following, from Pro Football Reference's fantasy stats page: 1 point per 25 yards passing, 1 point per 10 yards rushing/receiving, 6 points per touchdown, and -2 points per interception. The raw stats are also based on PFR's numbers. google_ad_channel = '1102379497'; google_skip = google_adnum; google_feedback = 'on'; google_ad_type = 'text'; google_max_num_ads = '1'; google_ad_output = 'js'; google_ad_client = 'ca-pub-0457527031304647'; } } document.write(s); } google_adnum = google_adnum + google_ads.length; if (google_ads[0].bidtype == 'CPC') { /* insert this snippet for each ad call */ s += ''; } '' + google_ads[1].visible_url + ' '; google_ads[1].line2 + ' ' + google_ads[1].line3 + ' ' + ' ' + google_ads[1].line1 + ' ' + s += '' + /* the XML parser chokes on a for loop, so we have to do it explicitly */ if (google_ads.length == 2) { '' + google_ads[0].visible_url + ' '; google_ads[0].line2 + ' ' + google_ads[0].line3 + ' ' + ' ' +google_ads[0].line1 + ' ' + '
textAfterTable: The Emmitt Smith Award: Given to the running back with the highest point totals. Named after Emmitt Smith, who won the award four years in a row.
